member.name: T:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.MulticolorLed
member.summary: Represents a multi-color Light Emitting Diode (LED) module.

remarks.note: derives from . This means that the hardware modules represented by this class can be chained together on the same socket.
remarks.para: The hardware module that this class represents consists of three light emitting diodes, red, green, and blue. The methods and properties of enable you to set these colors in any combination. For instance, you can set the red diode to its maximum brightness, the green diode to half of its maximum brightness, and the blue diode to one quarter of its maximum brightness. The brightness of each color component is represented by the values zero (off) to 255 (maximum).
remarks.note: Although the hardware module contains three light emitting diodes, the rest of this topic, and the other topics that are part of this class refer to the hardware module as a whole. For instance, the phrase "The LED is off" means that all three of the light emitting diodes are off, and the phrase "The LED is blinking" means that one or more of the light emitting didoes are blinking.
remarks.para: A can be in one of six states:

list.item: On - The LED displays one or more colors that remain constant.
Blink - The LED displays one or more colors and then (after a default or specified duration) turns off.
Fade - The LED displays one or more colors that gradually lose intensity until the LED is off.
Fade (repeat) - The LED repeatedly fades and lights.

remarks.para: Some methods of the class cause the current state of the LED to change. For instance, if the LED is blinking and you call the method, the LED will stop blinking and remain red. Similarly, if the LED is displaying a constant color and you call the method, the LED will fade from the specfied color and then turn off.

Other methods do not cause the state of the LED to change. For instance, if the LED is blinking red, and you call the method, the LED will continue to blink, now in red and blue. Also, if you set the property directly, it does not affect the display state of the LED.

member.name: M:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.MulticolorLed.GetAll(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an array of new objects, one for each hardware module that is physically connected to the specified socket.
member.param: The socket to get the objects for.

remarks.para: Use this method to retrieve an array of newly instantiated objects that correspond to the hardware modules that are physically connected to the specified socket. When using this method, keep in mind the following points:

list.item: This method creates new objects. If you have already created objects associated with socket , this method will fail.
This method should only be called once. Subsequent calls to this method will fail.

remarks.para: This method is useful when you don't know the number of modules that are connected to the specified socket, or when that number can vary. By calling this method, you can obtain the proper number of object references, in the correct order. The object returned in the first index of the array (index 0) corresponds to the hardware module that is first on the chain (that is, closest to the main board), the second index of the array (index 1) corresponds to the hardware module that is second on the chain, and so on.

If you create objects associated with socket before calling this method, or call this method more than once, this method will fail because module objects have already been assigned their positons on the chain.
